intro: Rhynchosia huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén bean, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in Ecuador and Peru, where it grows in humid, tropical environments. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by elongated pods containing edible seeds. Rhynchosia huillensis is valued for its nutritional content, as the seeds are rich in protein and can be used in traditional cuisines. Additionally, it has potential agricultural value due to its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, benefiting surrounding plant life.
